title: Accelerating Accessible Software Development for People with Motor Disabilities

speakers.name: Yvette Menase
speakers.bio: Yvette Menase is the Principal Product Manager at Libsyn, the leading podcast hosting and distribution company, which hosts more than 75,000 unique shows and is responsible for over 6 billion downloads per year. She drives podcast creation and host-agnostic monetization via Libsyn Studio and Glow.fm, as well as advertising technology and audio recording. Prior to joining Libsyn, she had 15 years of experience in product management, people management, software engineering, and accounting at various companies. She is also the Director of Surveys at Code & Supply Co., which is a tech community of over 8,000 people worldwide. Her volunteer work includes the execution and analysis of microsurveys and the organization's flagship Compensation Survey, that provides salary and lifestyle data to advocate for and empower job seekers & businesses. Yvette also leads and participates in various mentorship and coaching programs for professional and personal development and serves on the BOD for WIT PGH.

description:
In today's digital world, many people with motor disabilities face barriers when accessing and using software due to their assistive device & physical limitations. In this talk, we will discuss strategies and best practices for designing software that is accessible to people with motor disabilities.

The talk will start with an overview of the types of motor disabilities that can affect a person's ability to use software, including SMA, cerebral palsy, muscular dystrophy, spinal cord injuries, and more.

We will cover the types of motor disabilities that can affect a person's ability to use software, the design principles and techniques for making software more accessible, testing strategies and tools, and real-world examples of software that has been designed and tested for accessibility.

Attendees will leave with actionable takeaways that can be applied to their own software development processes to create software that is more inclusive and accessible to everyone.
